p: The EOs of T. polium were extracted using hydrodistillation (HD) and microwave-assisted extraction (MAE) methods and produced 0.045% and 0.061% ( v/w) of yellow oils, respectively. The variation of the oil yield might be attributed to the extraction method used [ 32]. The extracted EOs were analyzed by Gas chromatography–mass spectrometry (GC–MS) and the chemical constituents were identified and described in Table 1. Twenty-seven compounds were identified from the hydro-distilled EO, representing 100% of the total mass, while 28 compounds were identified from MAE extracted EO.
